qemu: could not open hard disk image '/dev/cdrom'
And then quits
Ok.
Sorry.
Ok.
!keyboard
are you sure the disk is at /dev/cdrom?
I think it is at /media/cdrom0, but that dosnt work either.
verify by "cat /etc/mtab" and see if the path's right
Should I unmount it first? It automounted.
you could try that as well
How would I go about doing that?
type "cat /etc/mtab", see where the disk is mounted, then type "sudo umount <path>"
Wow. Actualy, I got it working by using /dev/hdc. Isnt that supposed to be my hard drive?
no, every device plugged into the ide controller get a label, cd/dvd drives included
you can add to the nameserver list on the network config panel. or just modify /etc/resolv.conf
but then you have to tell dhcp not to overwrite that file
they'll be checked in order, so just arrange them that way
